title: I think I'm finally done with the game...
self_text: I've been playing since the beginning of the game, and have had a lot of fun over the years but it seems like every new season/update has just made the game worse than it was before. The biggest issue for me is that there are so many things wrong with the game now, it would take an army of developers to fix all the issues and even then some people will still complain. It's also clear to me that the developers don't care about the quality of their own game anymore. They're more interested in getting money from players through microtransactions and making them feel bad about themselves so they spend more money on the game. I'm not saying that the game is completely unplayable or anything, but I'm just tired of dealing with the constant bugs, glitches, and imbalances. There are plenty of other games out there that I can play and enjoy without having to worry about any of these things. So yeah, I think I'm finally done with the game. Thanks for the memories though!

title: I'm getting a new phone and am not sure whether to buy the iPhone or Samsung
self_text: I've had iPhones for as long as they have been out, but my last two phones were Androids so I'm very familiar with both platforms. I think that overall the iPhone has a better user experience than android because it is more intuitive, but I do love some of the features on Android such as being able to set custom launchers and widgets.   For the longest time I've always thought that Apple products are overpriced compared to their competitors, and I still believe that this is true. However, I also know that Apple will support their devices for many years after they are released, which means that you can expect your device to be up-to-date for a longer period of time.   I'm trying to decide between buying an iPhone 13 Pro Max or a Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra. The iPhone is more expensive, but I like its software ecosystem and how well it integrates with my other Apple devices. The Samsung is cheaper, but I'm worried about software updates and bloatware.   What would you guys recommend? Do you think it's worth spending the extra money on an iPhone if you already have other Apple devices? Or should I just save money and go with the Samsung?

title: Can't find a way to get my partner on board with the new rules?
self_text: I am currently a homeowner and have been for about two years now, living in my home with my girlfriend of three years. We decided early on that we would both contribute to mortgage payments equally as well as all other expenses related to the house (taxes, insurance, utilities, maintenance) and that it was her job to be responsible for interior design/decorating etc..  She's recently started complaining that she feels like our financial situation isn't fair because she doesn't work. She says that while she does pay half the mortgage payment and bills she doesn't feel like it is equal since she has no income coming into the house. Now I don't mind covering more than half but she wants me to change everything around to make sure it is completely 100% fair and she feels like an equal contributor.  I've tried explaining to her that it isn't just about paying the bills when you own a house but also taking care of things like lawncare, appliance repair, etc... and if she did something for a business or side hustle that could potentially cover those costs then it wouldn't matter so much how much money she made. But she doesn't want to hear any of that and insists that being financially independent will give her peace of mind.  Now I want to support her in whatever goals she may have and help her become financially secure but I don't think giving up control over my finances or changing the existing system is the right answer. I do see what she's saying though and I can understand why she would feel insecure without her own source of income.  How do I approach this conversation and get her to see where I'm coming from? What steps can I take to help her gain some financial independence without compromising my own security? How should I handle this delicate situation so that we can reach a compromise that benefits us both?

title: How do I check if a string is an integer in C#?
self_text: Hi,  I have been trying to figure out how to check if a string is an integer in C#.  I have tried using the Int32.TryParse() method but it always returns false even when the string contains only digits.  Here is my code:  string str = "123";  if (Int32.TryParse(str, out int num))  {    Console.WriteLine("String is an integer");  }  else  {    Console.WriteLine("String is not an integer");  }  What am I doing wrong? Thanks for your help!

title: Do I need to file a claim?

There wasn’t any injuries but there was visible damage to my bumper/fender. The other party did admit fault at the scene so his insurance agent called me asking for details on what happened. He said that he would have his client call me with an apology and they will fix my car. After talking to him, I told him I wanted to get quotes just to be safe. title: Any thoughts on the future of game streaming?
self_text: I'm a huge gamer and have been following game streaming for years now, but I feel like it has never really taken off.  I think that there are a few reasons why game streaming is still not as popular as traditional gaming. One reason is that the technology is not quite there yet. Game streaming requires a very fast and reliable internet connection, which many people do not have. Another reason is that game streaming can be expensive. Most game streaming services charge a monthly fee, which can add up over time.  However, I think that game streaming has the potential to revolutionize the way we play games. If the technology improves and the price comes down, I think that game streaming could become the dominant way to play games in the future. What do you guys think about the future of game streaming? Do you think it will ever become mainstream? Are there any other challenges that need to be overcome before game streaming can reach its full potential?

title: ELI5: Why is there so much talk about the "American Dream" when it seems like an unattainable goal for most people?
self_text: I'm a young adult and I've been hearing about the American Dream my whole life, but it feels more like a myth than a reality. It seems like no matter how hard people work, they can't get ahead due to rising costs of living, stagnant wages, and increasing debt. So why do we still talk about it? Is it just a way to keep people motivated or is there something else going on here?

title: What do you think of the new Microsoft Flight Simulator?
self_text: I've been a long-time fan of flight simulators, and I was really excited to hear about Microsoft's new entry into the genre. After playing it for a few hours, I have to say that I'm impressed! The graphics are stunning, and the level of detail is incredible. It truly feels like you're flying in a real plane, which is something I haven't experienced in other flight simulators before.  However, there are also some things that could be improved. For example, the AI traffic is still a bit lacking, and the weather system could use some work. But overall, I think Microsoft has created a fantastic game that will appeal to both hardcore simmers and casual players alike.  What do you think of the new Microsoft Flight Simulator? Do you agree with my assessment? Let me know in the comments below!

title: I was on a call with my friend and he asked me what I do for work, so I told him I'm an engineer at google and then the entire conversation turned into him asking me to help him fix his printer.
self_text: It's not that I don't want to help but it's getting kind of ridiculous. Like I get being friends with someone who works in IT or something but I'm literally just some guy doing computer science things...

title: Is it worth upgrading from a RTX2060 to a RX7800XT?
self_text: I currently have an i5-13600K and a RTX2060, planning on upgrading my GPU as the RTX2060 is holding back performance in newer titles. Considering the price difference between both cards (RX7800XT being more expensive), would it be worth getting the upgrade or should I wait for the next generation of GPUs?

title: Are you able to get a refund if you cancel the game on steam during predownload?
self_text: I pre-purchased this game and was going through the steps of downloading it when I realized that my computer won't be able to run the game as it doesn't meet the minimum system requirements, so I canceled my purchase from Steam. Is it possible for me to still get a refund even though I had already started the download process?

title: Looking for a good FPS mousepad
self_text: I’m looking to buy an fps mouse pad, I have about $50-$80 to spend and I don’t know where to start. Any recommendations?  Thank you!

title: Is it worth upgrading to a RTX 4080?
self_text: I have an i7-12700K and a RTX 3070, so the upgrade would be just a GPU. My monitor is 1440p 165hz.  I’m not sure if the upgrade is worth the money since I don’t think my CPU will be able to keep up with it.

title: Is it okay to just play for fun?
self_text: I’m a new player and have been having a lot of fun with the game. But lately, I’ve noticed that most people are only focused on winning, which is fine. However, some people get angry when you don’t try your best or when you make mistakes. It makes me feel bad because I just want to enjoy the game without feeling like I need to be perfect.  I know that competitive games can be stressful, but is there any room for casual players who just want to have fun? Or am I expected to always give it my all, even if it means getting upset about losing?

title: What do you think about the new game?
self_text: Anyone else agree that it's not as good as the previous ones? I still like it though, but the story is not as interesting and I wish there was a way to play with friends online.

title: What is the best way to handle a difficult tenant?
self_text: I am not a landlord, but I have a friend who has a rental property and is dealing with a very difficult tenant. The tenant doesn't pay rent on time, doesn't follow the rules of the lease (smoking indoors), and is often rude and disrespectful when confronted about it. My friend wants to evict the tenant, but is worried about the legal implications.  What are some things my friend should consider before taking any action? Is there anything they can do to avoid a lengthy and costly eviction process?

title: Will a 3070 Ti be enough to play Cyberpunk 2077 on 1440p with ray tracing?
self_text: I'm currently saving up for an upgrade and I've been looking at the RTX 3070 Ti but I wanted to know if it will be enough to play Cyberpunk 2077 on 1440p with Ray Tracing enabled.

self_text: I have an RTX 3070, and I'm considering upgrading to the RTX 4080. My current monitor is a 1440p 165hz. I play a variety of games, including AAA titles like Cyberpunk 2077 and Assassin's Creed Valhalla. Would the upgrade be worth the cost for me?

title: How to get a second mortgage in Canada?
self_text: I'm looking to do some renovations on my house, and need additional money for it. The only way to be able to do it is by taking out a second mortgage. But I don't know how to go about doing that. Any tips or advice?

title: how do i get a job in the us?
self_text: hi, i'm a student at georgia tech and i've been trying to get an internship for next summer but it's really hard. i have no experience, my gpa is only 3.0, and i don't know anyone who works in tech. i'm starting to wonder if i should just give up and go back home after graduation. any advice?

title: Would you take a job from the guy who made your current job obsolete?
self_text: My company is looking for a part-time consultant to work on our legacy system. The legacy system is an old software I developed and now maintain, which has recently been replaced by a new system. I am now working on other projects within my company but they would like me to consult on the legacy system as well as help the next person get up to speed with it. It's not a big project (probably just 20 hours per month) so I don't think it will interfere too much with my existing work.  I guess my question is whether or not I should accept the offer. On the one hand, I could use the extra money, and it might be a good opportunity to learn more about consulting. But on the other hand, it seems weird to work on something that was supposed to be retired. And what if this guy gets fired because he can't figure out how to deal with the thing I built?   Also, do people hire consultants specifically to help them manage legacy systems?

title: PC Gaming for a Beginner? (50-70k INR)
self_text: Hi, I'm looking to get into the world of PC gaming but I am utterly clueless about all things PC. As the title suggests my budget is around 50-70k INR and I was hoping you could help me out with some ideas regarding what parts I should get. Also, as I'm completely new to the scene, it would be great if someone could explain the basics like how components work together or where can I find more information on them. Thanks in advance!

title: Getting a new phone, but no carrier coverage in my area?
self_text: I'm trying to get a new phone but it won't let me since there is no coverage on the carrier that has it.  I live in an area where all carriers have no service and am looking for options.  Any advice on what to do next?

title: Will I need to upgrade my PSU if I get a new GPU?
self_text: Hi, so I'm trying to build a gaming PC and I want to make sure that all the parts will work together before I buy them. My current system has an Intel i5-8400 CPU, a GTX 1660 Ti GPU and a Corsair RM550x power supply. If I were to upgrade from my GTX 1660 Ti to an RTX 3070, would my PSU be enough? And if it isn't what should I get instead? Thanks in advance!

title: How to not be a dumbass when talking to people on the phone?

self_text: Hi, so I was playing ranked and got a disconnect in the middle of the match. After that my game started crashing every time I tried to open it up and now when I try to start the game all I see is black screen.  I have contacted support but they told me that the issue might be on my side because there's nothing wrong on their end.   Is it possible to get a refund for the game since I can't even play it anymore?

title: Which CPU is the best for gaming?
self_text:
I’m looking to build a new PC and need help choosing which CPU would be the best fit. My budget is around $200-300, but I’m willing to spend more if it means getting something that will last me a while. I’m mostly going to be playing games, so performance in that area is my top priority.  I've been doing some research and have narrowed down my options to a few different CPUs: 

*   AMD Ryzen 5 5600X
*   Intel Core i5-12400F
*   AMD Ryzen 7 5700X
*   Intel Core i7-12700K

I’m not sure which one would be the best choice for my needs, so I was hoping you could give me some advice. What do you think of these CPUs, and are there any other ones that I should consider? Also, what kind of motherboard and RAM would I need to pair with each of these CPUs? Thanks!

title: What is the best way to learn coding?
self_text: I'm a beginner and want to learn how to code but don't know where to start. Any advice on what kind of coding language or resources would be best for me?

title: Is the new 4090 worth it?
self_text: I’m currently looking at upgrading my pc from a RTX 3080 to a RTX 4090, but I have been seeing that the price is very high and there are some issues with the power supply unit.  I was hoping to get more information on whether or not it's worth getting, especially considering that I don't think the resolution of 1440p will be enough to fully utilise it.

title: Why is it so difficult to get a new phone?
self_text: I've had the same iPhone for over 5 years now and I need to upgrade, but my bank won't allow me to open another credit card because of my low income.  I can buy an android phone for $400 with cash, but I'm not sure if that would be worth it since iPhones are more secure and reliable.  I don't know what to do.

title: Is it wrong to ask someone to get their own apartment if they are unemployed and just mooching off of me?
self_text: I'm a college student who is working full time during the summer, earning around $15/hour. I live with my parents but pay for all of my bills (rent, utilities, phone, internet) which adds up to about $600/month. My older brother has been living with us since he lost his job last year. He does nothing except play video games and watch tv all day. My dad says he wants him to move out so he can start taking responsibility for himself, but when I mention it to him he gets really mad and starts yelling at everyone. It makes me uncomfortable because I feel like I'm making things worse by bringing it up. But it's unfair that he lives here rent-free while I am paying everything myself. Is it wrong to ask someone to get their own apartment if they are unemployed and just mooching off of me?

title: Can't turn off the light on my keyboard
self_text: I have a G715 mechanical gaming keyboard and it keeps turning on even after I press Fn+F20 to shut it off, is there anything I can do?

title: Can I get a refund for an item I bought during the free giveaway?
self_text: When I first started playing, there was a free giveaway of the skin “Cody” on Fortnite. I didn’t have any money at the time so I just claimed it and moved on. A few weeks later my parents got me some V-Bucks and I decided to buy something from the Item Shop. The game let me purchase the item but when I tried to use it in a match it said that I can only play with items that are purchased before the free giveaway. Is this normal? Will I be able to use my purchased skins?  Thanks!

title: Will my RTX 2070 be able to run Cyberpunk on ultra settings at 144hz?
self_text: I have an RTX 2070 and a 144hz monitor. My CPU is Ryzen 5 3600, 16gb of ram and the game will be installed in an NVME SSD. Do you guys think it would be possible to get around 144fps on Ultra settings?
